### In-class exercise using R
### Penguin tagging data

```{r, eval = FALSE}




n1 <- 167
n2 <- 189

y1 <- 33
y2 <- 68

n <- c(n1, n2)
y <- c(y1, y2)

 find sample proportions
p1 <- y1 / n1
p2 <- y2 / n2
p1
 0.1976048
p2
 0.3597884

z <- qnorm(0.975)

 standard error
se <- sqrt(p1*(1-p1)/n1 + p2*(1-p2)/n2)
se
 0.0465637

 95% Confidence Interval
p1 - p2 - z * se
p1 - p2 + z * se

p1 - p2 + c(-1, 1) * z * se
 -0.2534467 -0.0709204

 99% Confidence Interval
z99 <- qnorm(0.995)
z99
p1 - p2 + c(-1, 1) * z99 * se
 -0.28212370 -0.04224344


prop.test(y, n, correct = FALSE)
 95 percent confidence interval:
 -0.2534467 -0.0709204

prop.test(y, n, correct = FALSE, conf.level = 0.99)
 99 percent confidence interval:
  -0.28212370 -0.04224344

p <- (y1+y2)/(n1+n2)

se.p <- sqrt(p*(1-p)*(1/n1+1/n2))

Z <- (p1-p2) / se.p
Z
pnorm(Z) * 2
















































```
